greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer triangles with perimeter n which are obtuse and isosceles.
example: For n=11 there are A005044(11)=4 integer triangles: [1,5,5], [2,4,5], [3,3,5] and [3,4,4]; only one of the two obtuses ([2,4,5] and [3,3,5]) is also isosceles; therefore a(11)=1.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 05 2002
